result.execSummary:
The defendant Aric D Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $2804 payable to Leon Williamson Funeral Home joint and several with codefendant (15CF1670).

The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, restitution and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
.
with credit for 282 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. spc

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 2/15/2016:  "therefore it is hereby ordered that the "use of dangerous weapon" penalty enhancer shall be removed from the judgment of conviction.  The defendant was not convicted of the  penalty enhancer."
Granting Motion to Modify Judgment of Conviction.  Penalty enhancer Use of a Dangerous Weapon shall be removed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. mag
Motion to Modify Judgment of Conviction and Circuit Court Record
Count 2 is on Amended Information as Count 1.

Defendant Aric D Jones in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Aric D Jones in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, with credit for 282 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant to maintain employment.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $2804 payable to Leon Williamson Funeral Home joint and several with codefendant (15CF1670).
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, restitution and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,

received from defense counsel on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Aric D Jones in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Aric D Jones in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN.
AS COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Homicide by Negligent Handling of a Dangerous Weapon, Explosives or Fire, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.08(1), 939.50(3)(g) a Felony G.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Regarding Admission of Hearsay Pursuant to an Exception Under Wis. Stats. Sec. 908.03(2) - Excited Utterance.

Defendant Aric D Jones in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Aric D Jones in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Aric D Jones in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Aric D Jones in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel previously filed a motion to sever this case with the co-defendant's matter. State does not object to severance. Court granted defense request and ordered this matter severed with case 15CF1670. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 7/27/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Severance received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Aric D Jones in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Defendant Aric D Jones in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06JV1685 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Gust Petropoulous-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
